intro: Symphyandra stylosa, commonly known as the slender symphyandra, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough, textured surface. Symphyandra stylosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
